definition: wet spongy ground, a poorly drained usually acid area rich in accumulated plant material, frequently surrounding a body of open water, and having a characteristic flora (as of sedges, heaths, and sphagnum)
to cause to sink into or as if into a bog (see bog entry 1) : impede, mire
examples: a car that had gotten bogged down in the mud
easy to get bogged down in the details
Extra demand can cause the system to bog down.
